meanings.definition: Regard or represent as perfect or better than in reality.
meanings.sent1: She keeps idealising her favorite singer, thinking he can do no wrong.
meanings.sent2: People often enjoy idealising their vacation destinations before actually visiting them.
meanings.sent3: He was idealising his cooking skills so much that he burnt the dinner.
meanings.sent4: The children were idealising the idea of a magical land hidden in the forest.
meanings.sent5: Her paintings are full of idealising scenes of nature, with vibrant colors and perfect shapes.

meanings.definition: To form an ideal or perfect image of.
meanings.sent1: The artist spent hours idealising the portrait of his muse, capturing every detail.
meanings.sent2: When planning the event, she was idealising how the decorations would look in the venue.
meanings.sent3: He was idealising his dream car, imagining it with wings and flying through the sky.
meanings.sent4: The writer was idealising the protagonist as a symbol of hope and resilience.
meanings.sent5: The architect was idealising the design of the building, aiming for both beauty and functionality.
